question: How do I make a payment?
answer:
Payments can be made using the following options:
1) Student Portal – Pay directly through the Student Portal > Financial > Program Fees Payment (credit card; fastest method).
2) Web Banking – Add Conestoga College as a payee in your mobile banking app. Use your Student ID as the account number.
3) Flywire or Convera – For international payments; details available under International > Apply to Conestoga > Fees and Payment.

question: Can I have an extension or installment plan for my payment due?
answer:
Extensions are NOT offered. However, the Payment Schedule is available for eligible students in Level 2 or higher.
The Payment Schedule allows students to:
• Pay 50% of fees by the due date  
• Pay the remaining 50% three days before classes begin  
Costs and requirements:
• $200 fee to opt in  
• $150 late fee if added after the Payment Due Date  
• Steps to opt-in:
   1) Confirm invoice on Student Portal  
   2) Pay 50% of the invoice due  
   3) Opt in via Student Portal > Financial > My Invoices once payment is received.

question: Why has my payment not been posted to the Student Portal? / Can you confirm my payment?
answer:
Payments may take **3–5 business days** to be processed and appear in the Student Portal.
Once posted, receipts can be accessed under the Financial tab.
Level 1 International Students can find a Confirmation Letter on the OCAS Portal.

question: How much do I owe for Winter 2024?
answer:
If your timetable is not visible, you may owe Winter 2024 fees. Check the Financial tab in the Student Portal.
To calculate your remaining balance:
Remaining Winter 2024 = Total Due – Future Billing (e.g., 2024 Spring).
